qas.question: What are examples of finite symmetry groups used in coding theory?
What is used for error correction of transferred data?
What describes functions having antiderivatives of a prescribed form?
What concept investigates geometric elements that stay stable under group action?
What theory is error correction applied to?
Which form of finite symmetry groups are useless in coding theory?
Mathieu groups have what kind of prescribed form?
What stable properties does the Galois theory study?
Geometric Invariant theory studies what kind of equations?

context: Finite symmetry groups such as the <a0_0><b5_0>Mathieu<b5_0/> groups<a0_0/> are used in <a1_0><b4_0>coding<b4_0/> theory<a1_0/>, which is in turn applied in error correction of transmitted data, and in CD players. Another application is <a2_0>differential Galois theory<a2_0/>, which characterizes functions having <b6_0>antiderivatives<b6_0/> of a prescribed form, giving group-theoretic criteria for when solutions of certain <b8_0>differential<b8_0/> equations are well-behaved.u[›] <b7_0>Geometric<b7_0/> properties that remain stable under group actions are investigated in (geometric) <a3_0>invariant theory<a3_0/>.
